newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australian Senate debates Telstra bill.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australian Senate debates Telstra bill.

text.p: The Australian Senate was debating at 0300 GMT (2 p.m.) the bill to privatise a third of telecoms carrier Telstra Corp and was expected to vote finally on the bill sometime after 0430 GMT (3.30 p.m.).
The bill passed the main debating stage -- the second reading -- on Thursday. Currently it is "in committee", the stage at which senators can move to amend it.
So far, no amendment has been moved, although key independent senator Brian Harradine says he has an agreement with the government to make a minor amendment.
After all amendments are made, the bill is presented again to the Senate for a final vote, the third reading.

The government is two votes short of a majority in the Senate and all non-government senators except the two independents are against the proposed sale. Those independents are expected to back the bill, because they set out certain conditions that the government appears to have met.
Further, the joint amendment by Harradine and the government means that he will be happy to back the bill in that amended form.
